page.title: 13Industries and Factories
page.content: Belper waste factory recycles paper glass,plastic, and textiles,the material is brought in and sorted into groups ready to be recycled, and now the brick works is part of Belper waste.The Derbyshire highways chemical plant tests building materials for places such as fire stations, hospitals, schools and roads.They test the strength of bricks, concrete, slabs, clay, tarmac and soil.At the Depot they also repaired buses, library vans, and lorries. At the sawmills they make pine kitchen units, stairs and window frames. They use old wood that is 200 years old, because it is much harder than new pine.The plastic factory makes plastic fencing and runners for kitchen drawers, and plant rings and labels.It brought the raw plastic in, and manufactured it.
